newsitem.title: NIGERIA: NIGERIA SAYS OIL REFINERY REFURBISHMENT MUST WAIT.
newsitem.headline: NIGERIA SAYS OIL REFINERY REFURBISHMENT MUST WAIT.

text.p: Nigerian Finance Minister Anthony Ani said on Monday refurbishment of ailing oil refineries would have to wait until military ruler Sani Abacha gives the go-ahead and a suitable contractor is found.

"The head of state General Abacha has not approved the release of $200 million set aside for refurbishing of all the refineries and we are still looking for a credible contractor," Ani told a news conference in the capital Abuja.
Ani warned that until the refineries are repaired, Nigeria, which pumps over two million barrels of oil per day, would suffer from fuel shortages.

Petroleum Minister Dan Etete said last week his ministry had received money from the finance ministry which would be used for turnaround maintenance of the four refineries, which are operating well below their 445,000 barrels per day capacity.

But a senior petroleum ministry official later said the finance ministry had refused to release the money directly to state-run Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation and intended to pay contractors directly.
Etete and Ani publicly criticised each other last month over the release of funds to the oil industry.
